Hi Stephanie, 
When I worked for the City of Raleigh, North Carolina, day-to-day asset management was completed through Cityworks, a software program designed to couple with GIS technology to keep track of work requests and maintenance. 
Here are a few examples of asset management plans and case studies I found online, just in case they are of any help: 
http://squamish.ca/files/PublicWorksAssetMgmnt.pdf 
http://www.fhwa.dot.gov/asset/if08008/amo_06.cfm 
This particular plan is from Matanuska-Susitna Borough, which used to be a participant in the ICMA Center for Performance Measurement, which can be found here:   http://www.icma.org/performance 
http://www.matsugov.us/index.php?option=com_docman&task=doc_view&gid=1879&tmpl=component&format=raw&Itemid=238

author: Stephanie Klinkenberger
text:
I had posted a query a couple of days ago.  I would like to add to the question posted previously which is  stated below:  
The City of Virginia Beach is seeking information on how other localities are managing their assets. Types of assets included in this research are:
•   Electrical and mechanical equipment (e.g., HVAC systems)
•   Building components (e.g., roofs)
•   Technology (e.g., network equipment, servers)
•   Parks and Recreation Equipment (e.g., boilers, air compressors)
•   Fire station equipment (e.g., refrigerators, stoves)
•   Generators
Virginia Beach currently manages the types of assets listed above by functional area. For example, Public Works manages the building assets, the Technology Department manages all technology, Parks and Recreation manages parks assets, etc.
We are not including the following in this study:
•   The building structures themselves
•   Water and sewer infrastructure
•   Storm water infrastructure
•   Roadways
Our question:  Does your locality manage your assets by functional area or by collecting asset data in one place so you can manage those assets more comprehensively?
An additional question follows:  
"Does your locality have an asset management plan that includes such things as major equipment, building systems, parks equipment, and/or trails?"
If so, may we please have a copy and if at all possible as soon as possible.  Please send to: 
Lee Hedlund Senior Management and Budget Analyst
Department of Management Services
Virginia Beach, VA  23456
Ph. 757-385-8388
Fax 757-385-1857
lhedberg@vbgov.com
Many many thanks in advance.
